MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapYearMonth Parse(string value) cil managed

Docs.summary: Converts the specified into a object.
Docs.returns: A object that is obtained from .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Parse method is capable of parsing strings in various formats. The recognizable string formats are composed out of the following format patterns.
|Format Pattern|Description|Examples| |--------------------|-----------------|--------------| |yyyy|The year in 4-digit format.|1999, 1812| |MM|The numeric month. Single-digit months have a leading zero.|11, 05| |zzz|The full time zone offset (hour and minutes) from the Universal Time Coordinate (Greenwich Mean Time). Single-digit hours have a leading zero.|-07:00, 08:00|
## Examples The following code example shows how to use this method. This code example is part of a larger example that is provided for the <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapYearMonth> class.
[!code-cs[System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapYearMonth#11](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.runtime.remotin_54_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapYearMonth#11](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/m-system.runtime.remotin_54_1.cpp)]

Docs.exception: does not contain a date and time that corresponds to any of the recognized format patterns.
